casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Edward Allen PINEIRO, Defendant-Appellant. No. 01-6981. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted Oct. 31, 2001. Decided Dec. 18, 2001. Edward Allen Pineiro, Pro Se. Jean Barrett Hudson, Office of the United States Attorney, Charlottesville, Virginia, for Ap-pellee.

Before TRAXLER and KING, Circuit Judges, and HAMILTON, Senior Circuit Judge.

PER CURIAM.

Edward Allan Pineiro seeks to appeal the district court’s order denying his motion filed under 28 U.S.C.A. § 2255 (West Supp.2001). We have reviewed the record and the district court’s opinion and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we deny a certificate of appealability and dismiss the appeal on the reasoning of the district court. See United States v. Pineiro, Nos. CR-97-37; CA-00-341-7 (W.D.Va. May 15, 2001). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

DISMISSED.
